dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You know, I was just thinking, like, instant messengers, totally safe, right? Like, impenetrable.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, I was just thinking, like, instant messengers, totally safe, right? Like, impenetrable.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh my gosh, no! Dude, absolutely not! Like, quite the opposite, actually.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh my gosh, no! Dude, absolutely not! Like, quite the opposite, actually.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wait, really? Because I always figured, um, they're pretty locked down.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wait, really? Because I always figured, um, they're pretty locked down.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, no. The National Bank just put out this huge warning. Like, scammers are everywhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, no. The National Bank just put out this huge warning. Like, scammers are everywhere.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank has published a warning about fraudulent schemes using fake or hacked personal accounts of users in instant messengers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, really? Using, like, fake accounts, then?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, really? Using, like, fake accounts, then?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! They're pretending to be, like, National Bank employees, or, uh, even government officials.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! They're pretending to be, like, National Bank employees, or, uh, even government officials.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Intruders in instant messengers use fake accounts of employees of the National Bank of Kazakhstan or other government and law enforcement agencies, while for the authenticity of the profile, they use images and emblems from publicly available sources, including those posted on the official resources of the departments,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's wild. And they're probably using, like, official logos and stuff from, like, the internet?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's wild. And they're probably using, like, official logos and stuff from, like, the internet?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! From publicly available sources. And they even pretend to be tech support!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! From publicly available sources. And they even pretend to be tech support!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: for the authenticity of the profile, they use images and emblems from publicly available sources... The National Bank notes that fraudsters, posing as employees of the technical support service of instant messengers, send messages about submitting an application to delete an account.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: No way! Tech support saying what, that your account's getting deleted?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No way! Tech support saying what, that your account's getting deleted?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! And then they tell you to go to some website, uh, give your phone number, and enter a one-time code.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! And then they tell you to go to some website, uh, give your phone number, and enter a one-time code.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To cancel the decision, citizens are asked to go to a website where they must provide their phone number and enter a one-time code received in a message.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, of course, then gives them access. Right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, of course, then gives them access. Right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! They gain control, block you out. Then they hit up all your friends and family for money.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! They gain control, block you out. Then they hit up all your friends and family for money.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In this way, the attackers gain access to the account and block the user. Then, using fake or stolen accounts, the attackers write to relatives and friends and, under various pretexts, ask them to transfer money, follow a link, download an application, activate new functions in the messenger, or provide personal data,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Ugh, that's so sneaky! Or like, asking them to download apps, I bet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Ugh, that's so sneaky! Or like, asking them to download apps, I bet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, or, um, follow weird links! Or those QR codes you see for "high-paying jobs."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, or, um, follow weird links! Or those Q R codes you see for high-paying jobs.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Then, using fake or stolen accounts, the attackers write to relatives and friends and, under various pretexts, ask them to transfer money, follow a link, download an application... According to the state regulator, the fraudsters also send out messages or publish QR codes in public places with offers of promising work with a high salary.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, those! So, like, don't click anything, don't trust anyone?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, those! So, like, don't click anything, don't trust anyone?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Pretty much! Don't disclose confidential info. Double-check everything.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Pretty much! Don't disclose confidential info. Double-check everything.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The National Bank calls on citizens to be more vigilant and not to disclose confidential information to third parties, not to trust suspicious messages in messengers and phone calls, to double-check the authenticity of requests and not to make money transfers, not to open questionable links and files...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And, um, definitely don't install those sketchy remote access apps, like AnyDesk or TeamViewer.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And, um, definitely don't install those sketchy remote access apps, like AnyDesk or TeamViewer.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...and not to install remote access applications HopToDesk, RustDesk, RUDesktop, AnyDesk, TeamViewer and others,

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yes, exactly! And if someone calls pretending to be official, just hang up and call their actual official number yourself.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yes, exactly! And if someone calls pretending to be official, just hang up and call their actual official number yourself.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: To protect against fraudsters, the National Bank recommends that when receiving calls from alleged employees of government agencies or the National Bank, you interrupt the conversation and, if necessary, call the official number of the government agency yourself.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Smart. So, basically, just be super, super vigilant.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Smart. So, basically, just be super, super vigilant.
